title: Remove specific DOM node by XPath

requirements.summary: Remove only the rendered DOM node that matches the provided XPath, without impacting surrounding UI or causing runtime errors.
acceptanceCriteria: The DOM node at XPath `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]` is no longer present after the change.
No other UI elements outside the selected XPath are removed or visually altered (other than natural reflow from removing this element).
The page renders without runtime errors or console errors after the element removal.

file_operations.description: Create a small React hook that, on mount, safely locates the exact node via document.evaluate for the given XPath and removes it if present (guarded for SSR/undefined document, null results, and non-Element nodes; swallow/console.debug on failure to avoid console errors).

Wire the XPath-based removal hook into the app shell so it runs after render and removes only the specific node at `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]` when present, without modifying any other layout or components.
